subject: Marketing
title: Content as Compound Interest
description: A quick, practical guide to Content as Compound Interest.

hook.text: A blog post written in 2015 still generates leads in 2025. An ad from 2015 is long gone.

buildup.text: Paid advertising stops the moment you stop paying. Content keeps working indefinitely.

discovery.text: Compounding content builds an ever-growing library that attracts audiences passively.

twist.text: HubSpot generates 80% of its leads from posts published more than a month ago.

climax.text: Content is not an expense. It's an investment that appreciates over time.

punchline.text: Ads rent attention. Content builds equity.

quiz.question: How does content marketing compound over time?
options: Older content continues generating leads long after publication
Content becomes more expensive to produce each year
Search engines only rank content from the current year
